official-title.#text:
To amend the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide
		  for the proper Federal management and oversight of transboundary hydrocarbon
		  reservoirs, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

header.#text:
Amendment to
			 the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may implement the terms of any transboundary hydrocarbon agreement
				for the management of transboundary hydrocarbon reservoirs entered into by the
. In implementing such an agreement, the

shall protect the interests of the United States to promote domestic
				job creation and ensure the expeditious and orderly development and
				conservation of domestic mineral resources in accordance with all applicable
				United States laws governing the exploration, development, and production of
				hydrocarbon resources on the outer Continental Shelf.

text.#text: The

No later than 180 days after all parties to a
				transboundary hydrocarbon agreement have agreed to its terms, a transboundary
				hydrocarbon agreement that does not constitute a treaty in the judgment of the
				President shall be submitted by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Speaker of the
				House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: the
the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chair of the
				Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives

text.#text: the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chair of the
				Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

text.#text: the

The submission
				shall include—

any amendments to
				this Act or other Federal law necessary to implement the agreement;

an analysis of the
				economic impacts such an agreement and any amendments necessitated by the
				agreement will have on domestic exploration, development, and production of
				hydrocarbon resources on the outer Continental Shelf; and

a detailed
				description of any regulations expected to be issued by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may take actions as necessary
				to implement the terms of the Agreement between the United States of America
				and the United Mexican States Concerning Transboundary Hydrocarbon Reservoirs
				in the Gulf of Mexico, signed at Los Cabos, February 20, 2012,
				including—

text.#text: The

approving
				unitization agreements and related agreements for the exploration, development,
				or production of oil and natural gas from transboundary reservoirs or
				geological structures;

making available,
				in the limited manner necessary under the agreement and subject to the
				protections of confidentiality provided by the agreement, information relating
				to the exploration, development, and production of oil and natural gas from a
				transboundary reservoir or geological structure that may otherwise be
				considered confidential, privileged, or proprietary information under
				law;

taking actions
				consistent with an expert determination under the agreement, provided that the
				expert determination proceedings were open to the public to the greatest extent
				practicable; and

ensuring that
				agents of a foreign government may not stop work or interfere with exploration,
				development, or production activities as approved by the

Actions taken by a
				public company in accordance with any transboundary hydrocarbon agreement shall
				not constitute the commercial development of oil, natural gas, or minerals for
				purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 13(q) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

header.#text:
Exemption from
				resources extraction reporting requirement

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to participate
				in any negotiations, conferences, or consultations with Cuba regarding
				exploration, development, or production of hydrocarbon resources in the Gulf of
				Mexico along the United States maritime border with Cuba or the area known by
				the

text.#text: to authorize the

as affecting the sovereign rights and the

				it.

header.#text:
Amendment to the
			 Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act

text.#text:
The
			 Agreement between the United States of America and the United Mexican States
			 Concerning Transboundary Hydrocarbon Reservoirs in the Gulf of Mexico, signed
			 at Los Cabos, February 20, 2012, is hereby approved.

short-title.#text:
Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary
			 Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1613 IH: Outer Continental Shelf Transboundary Hydrocarbon Agreements Authorization Act
